title: Vayne's winratio skyrocketed to 54% in the span of one day.
body:
https://my.mixtape.moe/cmqwhg.png
Obviously, the patch is still fresh so a lot can change. Regardless, I believe this gives a clear picture as to how exactly Vayne buffs effected her. 
I for one am going to enjoy the incomning shitstorm. I've got my popcorn ready.
 {{sticker:sg-lulu}}

replies.body: Sorry.  On the bright side, you can play ~~Kai'sa~~ Vayne 2.0 against me now since I can't ban two champions!

A year should suffice.

Way, way ahead of you.

I haven't bought anything for the past two years or so, any skin I've obtained in that period was from boxes alone (that Snowstorm event gave me a bunch of skins from saved up boxes, by pouring the stuff on key fragments).

Good to see a lot more people are being more reserved with their money. EA and Bethesda are still licking their wounds. Activision is sh*tting themselves, expecting a poor financial year in 2019.  It really DOES work.

Totaly not cashgrab buff since  if vayne players like the skin they will buy it nonetheless.
Its just a trash buff ona  trash champion whit a polarising kit making her even more polarising no news there.

Need to be careful with external sites when it comes to reporting the current day - there tends to be weird things with how the data gets parsed. See below for an example on Cass - her winrate certainly didn't plummet to 44% today.

https://imgur.com/5pnaFmu

The image below is what we're seeing in regards to her winrate increase at high mmr (plat+). 

https://i.imgur.com/rC5edyD.png

Can't for the life of me get those images to work inline with the post, but if you hover over them you can see em.

On that note...

Do you know why that happens with external sites? Does Riot ever have any intention of getting a better API or possibly just publishing stats themselves? It seems like you guys have them, and I think it would really help the community get on the same page as the devs if we had a way to see the same numbers.

> [{quoted}](name=KnightsKemplar,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WlqLIxol,comment-id=00230001,timestamp=2019-01-11T03:04:23.303+0000)
>
> On that note...
> 
> Do you know why that happens with external sites? Does Riot ever have any intention of getting a better API or possibly just publishing stats themselves? It seems like you guys have them, and I think it would really help the community get on the same page as the devs if we had a way to see the same numbers.

Riot obviously doesn't want stats freely available, just remember that in recent seasons they even REMOVED stats and those ranked stats section on your profile is a bloody worthless joke.

I don't think that's an obvious conclusion at all. 

I think a much more likely explanation is that they only have so much manpower, and making a unified stats platform isn't a top priority. The only way we can change that is to mention, frequently and politely, that we players are very interested in them making that a priority.

> [{quoted}](name=KnightsKemplar,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WlqLIxol,comment-id=0023000100000000,timestamp=2019-01-11T15:20:26.236+0000)
>
> I don't think that's an obvious conclusion at all. 
> 
> I think a much more likely explanation is that they only have so much manpower, and making a unified stats platform isn't a top priority. The only way we can change that is to mention, frequently and politely, that we players are very interested in them making that a priority.

I'm pretty sure the community made it clear that they want stats some seasons ago already, but Riot's philosophy is that looking at stats can be discouraging you from playing to improve and encourages playing for stats so they feel like it would make the game worse.

That's not on topic even remotely. I don't want personal stats, not was my comment about personal stats at all.

I'm asking if we can get accurate stats for the game regarding champions, rune selection, item builds, etc. The key problem here is the OP thinks Vayne got a 5+% boost to her win rate, and Riot doesn't see that in their own data. *That's* the discrepancy we need to solve. That has nothing to do with personal stats.

>That's the discrepancy we need to solve.

Publishing stats creates a new discrepancy - one between the players' opinions of acceptable stats and Riot's action or inaction in response.

It might lead to situations like this where OP thinks Vayne incorrectly spiked to 54% in a day. But it prevents situations where players might freak out over stats that are out of context, like Kayle's win rate or something. 

Hiding the stats also gives Riot a lot more room to just ignore things that players would identify as problems. This is a totally made-up example, but just humor me. Let's say that Ahri's third-party stats show her at 51% average win rate and 52% win rate in gold. Riot's stats break that down even further and reveal that gold Ahri mains with 150+ games have a 61% win rate. 

Riot might look at that and decide that Ahri overall is in a good place, and any change to bring down that 61% would have far more negative consequences than positive. So they let it sit, and those Ahri players see their win rates level off as they're carried out of gold. Riot's decision is utilitarian, but can you imagine the hellfire that would rain down from the community for a decision like that?

I think it would be an even bigger problem if everyone knew the full extent of the mastery curves. Blaustoise released Jax's mastery curve, and my reaction to that was.....not good. It basically confirmed that he's no-skill freelo, and it pissed me off to know that I can be 50 games into a a champion and have the same odds of winning as a Jax being played for the very first time. It was demoralizing to say the least, and it added to the frustration of seeing him go un-nerfed before and after the love tap to his ult.

Question, if Vayne, a high skill champion was already at a 50% winrate why the fuck was she even getting buffed? Doesn't a champion who's meant to be hard to play being at a 50% winrate show that they're already really strong?

There's still one important question: Why?

Why Vayne and not something that actually needed buffs?

Tin Foil hat time :^)

Wanna know what's an even bigger joke, the stuff people say when defending this buff:

"Here's the thing about Vayne: She.has.to.land.the.auto.to.gain.the.reset. So, for as much as you think this is a stupid 1v5 buff, its only a QoL buff for Vayne players and that's about it."

"It's really not that big."

"She only has 550 range so this buff is fine."

"She's the worst ADC atm." (she wasn't actually lmao, that right goes to Kalista)

And people wonder why we set our bar so low in terms of expectations and general respect when dealing with your average ADC main.
Man I'm from Spain and yet I'm able to see that motherfucking giant strawman you just built on Oceania.

none of the quotes provided an example of vain doing badly, in another thread it was also quoted from Scarra that "any time vayne is meta, there is a problem" 

Why?  because she is built to burst tanks...what happens when you burst tanks?  you burst EVERYTHING
Thanks for quoting me when it honestly feels like people like you are sounding the sirens on DAY 1 when the sample size is unstable. And also, im not an ADC main, so keep assuming so.

But than new champs get buffed before their winrate becomes constant and ppl learn them.
Nope cant have that better buff ornn twice.
Ye im gona sound the sirens cuz  seems NOT ONLY THAT GONA HELP ANYWAY.

Ornn was shit on release though.
A better example would be Kai Sa.
The range increase and E lockout lowering made sense, the ratio shit went over the top real fast.
I never said you were, but I _am_ saying that your quote is quite laughable. That said, every other quote was from an ADC main, so woop dee doo, 1/4 quotes listed were not from an ADC main's mouth.
Ok, and your reaction to the buff could arguably be quite laughable as well, considering its day 1 of the new patch.

Except it's not. People reacted the same way to Kat in preseason 8 and she received 2 further nerfs and numerous indirect nerfs following it. Yet the moment an ADC like Vayne gets this really questionable and unneeded (and unwanted) buff people are quick to defend it.

"considering its day 1 of the new patch.", the worst win rate Vayne will have with this buff imo will be ~51%-52% which is still incredible. If you can not tell that this buff is ridiculous you're delusional and you're hoping to throw more fuel into fire rather than fix the initial problem which is the amount of damage in this current state of the game. Making Vayne have near perma-stealth and absurd kite potential will not solve this problem, it just makes another problem champion.

Furthermore, it's not a "QoL buff". A QoL buff would be to improve her auto's responsiveness after Condemn. A QoL buff would fall under what they did to Kat this patch, where they removed her cast time and added a rather large backloaded delay to her Shunpo, or something as simple as making Jax's W feel more responsive as an auto reset. What this change is, is a direct buff, and there's really nothing to be said that can refute this as being a fact.
QoL refers to a small change, this is far from small.

https://lolalytics.com/ranked/worldwide/platinum/plus/champion/Vayne/ 

aaaand it's down to under 51%
Well, we should wait a few days. Let the dust settle in.
Champ design is broken, why would she EVER receive a buff. I wouldn't buff her even if she was at 10% winrate

Just a note, if you use lolalytics.com as obsessively as I do, you'll notice that the most recent day of stats is always fucked up by as much as 5%. Tomorrow (after all the data is collected and processed), it will probably say that today's winrate ended up being 51-52%. I always have to wait 2 or 3 days after the patch to get any kind of confident read on the stats.

I'm not sure if it's a problem with the data collection, or if there are actually differences to be found in early-bird players vs. rest-of-the-day players causing the most recent (non-complete) day to have different stats. But it is a pretty consistent problem with lolalytics.

Who could have foreseen this???

(Hint - everyone)
Same people working on this game as Season 8. No reason for Season 9 to be any better.

I've always hated Vayne's w. The way to counter true damage is to stack health, and the way to counter % health damage is to stack resistances. However, she does both. You just can't build against her.  Honestly, I like the concept of her kit. I just hate that her W is so oppressive.

Plot twist her WR actually went down 5% in diamond+

Her Ban and Pick rates skyrocketed across all elos though

Almost like WR isn't a good indication on champ strength and Pick/ban rates are much better

INB4 comments about sample size

Plat+ is over 20000 games and Diamond+ is already over 2000 games

Nah no stat on its own its good, rather try to measure the "balance" between winrate, banrate and playrate and get a sense from where that leaves you.

A champ with 1% pickrate, 1%banrate and 55% winrate is probably too strong when mained but not OP. 

A champ with 60-70% pick&banrate is probably too strong even with winrate sitting at 49% or lower..,...however a champ with the same P/B rate but 45% winrate is much more likely to actually be in a good spot, especially if its a high skillcap one.

> [{quoted}](name=Thefrostyviking,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WlqLIxol,comment-id=000e0000,timestamp=2019-01-10T08:09:24.300+0000)
>

um no
They wouldnt have that sort of play&banrate if there wasnt some merit to it hence the likeliness of the winrate being alright is much higher x)
Okay, but the thing is that Vayne winrate isn't reliable just as any other champion if you look only on 2 days because you need more games to have a proper winrate.

To be honest i am uncertain if its the amount of days or the number of games played that matter, because normally waiting a few days before counting is just a way to ensure a sizeable sample size however if one becomes present earlier then waiting might not be a good thing.

Like the AP galio buff case.
Then will get nerfed to be worse than she was before she was buffed.
those nerfs are going to be juicy.

You think? I somehow have the feeling that it wont be something quick or easy with her getting a prestige skin so soon,,,,,rather wont Riot calmly ignore balance complaints and keep her strong to ensure they get as much as possible from sales?

It might be weeks until we see nerfs unless it really blows up.
This vayne buff is a blatant cash grab buff to get people to buy her prestige skin. Actually disgusting.
Thats because her change id broken and OPAF but Riot is clueless to balance

I have like a 53-54% winrate with Vayne over the course of the season and I've played around 350 games of her.


That does not mean the champion itself is winning 54% of her games as a whole.


Stats sites are showing she is winning around 50% in both roles she's played.
